content: It sounds like you might be thinking of "The Dies Irae" (or "Day of Wrath"), which is a famous Latin hymn that has been used in many classical music pieces to represent death and the end of the world. The use of the "devil's interval," also known as the tritone, is common in musical depictions of death and the supernatural. One of the most well-known examples of "The Dies Irae" being used in classical music is in the final movement of Mozart's "Requiem Mass in D minor," which features a prominent violin solo and includes a section that depicts knocking on a door, which becomes increasingly frenzied.
